definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: Queen Victoria ascended ascended the throne in 1837.
sentences.chinese: 維多利亞女王於1837年登上王位。

sentences.english: Queen Elizabeth Ⅱ was throned in 1952.
sentences.chinese: 英國女王伊麗莎白二世於1952年登上王位。

sentences.english: The heir apparent succeeded to the throne.
sentences.chinese: 法定繼承人繼承了王位。

sentences.english: And princes are always in line to the throne.

sentences.english: And Demetrius reigned in the hundred and sixty-seventh year.
sentences.chinese: 德默特琉遂登上王位，時在一百六十七年。

sentences.english: Its descendants will reign over it forever, whether gifted or boobies .
sentences.chinese: 它子子孫孫，不論賢愚，都永遠身居王位。

sentences.english: King Edward Ⅷ abdicated to marry a commoner.

sentences.english: He would later succeed to the throne6 of India and be called Emperor Shah Jahan.
sentences.chinese: 庫蘭王子後來則繼承了印度王位，被稱爲沙迦汗王。

sentences.english: Deliverers will go up on Mount Zion to govern the mountains of Esau. And the kingdom will be the Lord's.
sentences.chinese: 必有拯救者上錫安山來統治以掃山，王位就歸永恆主。

sentences.english: The king's oldest son is heir apparent to the throne.
sentences.chinese: 國王的長子是王位的法定繼承人。

sentences.english: The young king was uneasy on the throne.
sentences.chinese: 這位年輕的國王對身居王位感到很不自在。

definition: order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
